contents: Oscar Wilde once said, “Education is an admirable thing... but nothing worth knowing can ever be taught.” He was totally right. There’s more value in real-world experience than there is sitting in a classroom. I’ve learned a lot from working in a restaurant. I plan to run my own restaurant one day. I learned math by figuring out checks and calculating tax. I learned communication skills by conversing with customers and co-workers. If I couldn’t do that, I wouldn’t get a bad grade; I’d lose my job. And I’ve had to persuade them to buy our specials or our higher-priced items. Plus I’ve worked with people from all different backgrounds and with very different personalities. The restaurant business is the best education you can get. And it’s even better than a free education, because you get paid!
